title: David Wright - Full Interview
body: BALTIMORE (WBFF) – The race for City Council District 3 is between an incumbent of several years and a Republican outsider looking to bring transparency to City Hall.Democrat Ryan Dorsey is set to face GOP David Wright. Wright hasn’t held public office but said he has a plethora of ideas to bring transparency to City Hall.Ryan DorseyThe incumbent did not respond to a request for an interview to discuss his campaign and platform; he has a history of not speaking with FOX45 News.David WrightWright said voters should look beyond party affiliation and give other candidates a chance. He said part of his platform includes targeting education, community development and crime.“Crime is caused by a lot of systemic issues: poverty, untreated mental illness, addiction, unemployment, underemployment, recidivism,” he said. “We need to address the socioeconomic problems in the city so we can prevent crime from happening on one side of the house, and on the other side, prosecute the most violent crimes.”Wright said he wants to tackle transparency and restore public trust within City Hall, adding that starts with financial disclosure.“We need to know what revenue streams people have, potential conflicts of interest. We could avoid the scandals that have taken down our city before – like Catherine Pugh – that could have been avoided,” Wright said. “I don’t believe it’s a party issue, I believe it’s a people issue. We have to make sure the right folks are getting elected.”
